results.answer:
[RAG3] iLab is a comprehensive operations software platform developed by Agilent Technologies, designed to support the management and administration of core facilities, shared resources, and research laboratories. It provides tools for scheduling, billing, reporting, and managing various aspects of laboratory operations. iLab helps streamline processes such as equipment reservations, service requests, user management, and financial tracking.

Key features of iLab include:
1. **Signup and Login Assistance**: Tools to help users sign up for an account or log into the system.
2. **FAQs**: A collection of frequently asked questions for both core users and administrators.
3. **Video Tutorials**: Visual guides that provide step-by-step instructions on using different features of iLab.
4. **Quick-Start Guides**: Concise guides to help new users get started with iLab quickly.
5. **Role-Specific Articles**: Curated lists of articles tailored to different user roles such as Core Customers, Lab Group Managers, and Core Administrators.
6. **System Status Updates**: Information on the operational status and scheduled updates of the iLab system.
7. **Support Resources**: Access to support teams and forums for additional assistance.

iLab is hosted on multiple regional servers to optimize performance and comply with local data regulations, ensuring a reliable user experience across various continents.

For more detailed information about specific functionalities or assistance with using iLab, you can visit their [Help Site](https://nextgen-community.agilent.com/technical/ilab---stage-environment-testing/w/resources) or refer to their extensive library of articles and video tutorials available online.

<source id="1">Agilent Knowledge Base Article

Collection of iLab Operations Software Resources - Test
Author: guivieiraa | Created: 2023-11-16
Source URL: https://nextgen-community.agilent.com/technical/ilab---stage-environment-testing/w/resources

Note: This is a text-only fallback PDF. See HTML file for complete content with images.

[Test Env]
This is a compilation of some of the most useful iLab Help Resources. Whether you are a new user trying to
navigate the signup process, an experienced administrator seeking advanced management tips, or anyone in
between, this collection is designed to assist you throughout your iLab journey.
Visit the?iLab Help?Site for comprehensive articles detailing feature functionalities and step-by-step guides
on using all iLab features and modules.
Popular Resources
Signup and Login Questions: For assistance with signing up or logging into iLab, try the?iLab Signup and
Login Assistant?widget.
iLab Frequently Asked Questions - FAQs:?Find answers?to common queries for
Core?Users?and?Administrators.
iLab Video Tutorials:?Visual guides?for an easier understanding of iLab's functionalities.
Getting Started with iLab
iLab Quick-Start Guide: Begin your iLab journey with this?concise and practical guide.
Articles Collection by User Role
Core Customers: Explore a curated list of articles providing detailed instructions on?using a core.
Lab Group Managers: Find a list of articles for effectively?managing a group?in iLab.
Core Administrators: Access a compilation of articles covering all iLab features, settings, and instructions
on?managing a core.
System Status
iLab Status Page: Stay updated on the?operational status?and scheduled updates of the iLab system.
More Help
iLab Support: For further assistance,?contact the iLab Support Team?or post your question in the?Forum.

Page 1/1</source>

<source id="2">and Edit Policy

to OFF, then clicking the save button. Turning On Cancellation Notifications Core Customers

must toggle the switch for this setting on each calendar's View Schedule interface to enable

Cancellation Notifications. By turning it on, they will subscribe to email alerts when other Core

Customers cancel their scheduled reservations. A user remains subscribed until they turn off the

Cancellation Notification toggle. Core Customers Email Notifications Subscribed of the

Cancellation Notifications are notified via their iLab email address when a reservation is canceled.

The email notification includes: The name of the calendar; The canceled reservation time; And a

quick access link to the calendar; These notifications allow Core Customers with the appropriate

access, such as Training/Permissions, Access, Approvals, etc., to take advantage of the newly

available time slot.

Page 21



HelpJuice Articles

Article 11: Registering with iLab

ID: 1477856

URL: https://help.ilab.agilent.com/99540-getting-starte d-with-ilab/325013-registering -with-ilab

Published: True

Views: 22146

Description:

Content:

To create a new iLab account, you will need to fill out an Account Request form, either by: Using

the sign-up link sent to you by the Core facility; Using one of the generic sign-up links, divided by

iLab instances; Using your institutional credentials, if your Institute has ID integration (SSO) with

iLab. Unsure where to start? Use the iLab Login Tool NEW! Note For Institutions with ID

integration with iLab, once you access their landing page, click the Sign-up button on the

upper-right of your screen. Next, click on the link "Click here to log in or register using your

institute login and password." Depending on the institute, this message may differ slightly. This

article will cover: Choosing an iLab Instance Start Personal Information Group Associations Billing</source>

<source id="3">Agilent Knowledge Base Article

iLab FAQs
Author: guivieiraa | Created: 2023-12-04
Source URL: https://nextgen-community.agilent.com/technical/ilab---stage-environment-testing/w/resources/20029/ilab-faqs

Note: This is a text-only fallback PDF. See HTML file for complete content with images.

iLab FAQs for Core User and Admins

Page 1/1</source>

<source id="4">Visual learners can benefit from our collection of how-to videos.

These short, instructional clips offer step-by-step guidance on using different features of iLab,

making it easier for you to grasp and apply the functionalities effectively. Resource Library:

Access a wide range of files and guides that support your iLab usage. From user manuals to

quick reference sheets, this library is your go-to source for detailed information on various

aspects of iLab.

Page 14



HelpJuice Articles

Article 7: iLab Registration & Login Guide

ID: 2287669

URL: https://help.ilab.agilent.com/99540-getting-starte d-with-ilab/ilab-registration- login-guide

Published: True

Views: 10732

Description:

Role: All Users

Content:

iLab software serves a global user base, with institutions located across various continents. To

optimize performance and comply with local data regulations, iLab is hosted on six different

servers or instances. This regional server configuration ensures a more efficient and reliable user

experience. Regional Login Links Using the iLab Access Guide Widget Regional Login Links

United States: my.ilab.agilent.com Dana Farber Cancer Institute (DFCI): dfci.ilab.agilent.com

Stanford University: stanford.ilabsolutions.com Important: If you already have an account on

my.ilab.agilent.com, you will need to create a separate account for the DFCI or Stanford

instances to access their platforms. Similarly, users with DFCI or Stanford accounts cannot use

those credentials on my.ilab.agilent.com and will need to create an account for other U.S.-based

locations. Canada: ca.ilab.agilent.com Europe: eu.ilab.agilent.com Asia-Pacific:

au.ilab.agilent.com Using the iLab Access Guide Widget If you are unsure which link to use, the

iLab Access Guide Widget is available to assist you. This tool guides users to the correct iLab

landing page based on their institution's requirements. Simply follow the predefined questions,</source>

<source id="5">system. If this is the case, you will have been provided with an

institution-specific link (for example institution.ilabsolutions.com, institution.corefacilities.org, or

institution.ilab.agilent.com.) You can also check here if your Institution has ID integration with iLab

or if you will need iLab credentials to log in. Note If you intend to visit a core at an institution other

than your own, you should still log in using your own institution's login link. See the instructions

below. With an institution login, you will typically be presented with a screen similar to the one

below: Click on the "here" link in the top box to be sent to your institution's authentication page.

From here, authenticate with your institution credentials, after which you will be redirected to your

destination in iLab. If accessing a Core facility at an Institution other than your own, and your

institution is utilizing the SSO login authentication, click on sign in using other institution

credentials, search for and select your Institution from the drop-down list, and press Go . You will

then be redirected to your institution's login page and once logged in, you can access the needed

core by following the steps outlined here , if you have not landed onto the core page that was

needed. iLab Login If your institution does not have an ID Integration with iLab, you will use

iLab-provided credentials (username and password). Simply complete the Username (first field)

and Password and click "Sign In" to access iLab. For reference, some common iLab login pages

are: https://my.ilab.agilent.com (U.S.A.) https://eu.ilab.agilent.com (most of Europe)

https://au.ilab.agilent.com (Australia) https://ca.ilab.agilent.com (Canada) Please Contact Support

if you have any issues logging into iLab. Deactivated Account For security reasons, user accounts

that remain inactive for more than 90 days are automatically deactivated. This policy helps</source>

results.answer:
[RAG3] iLab is an operations software developed by Agilent Technologies primarily used for managing core facilities, research laboratories, and shared resources within academic institutions and research organizations. It streamlines various administrative tasks including scheduling, billing, reporting, and user management.

Key features of iLab:
1. **User Management:** Allows administrators to manage user roles, permissions, and access controls.
2. **Scheduling:** Provides tools for booking equipment and reserving time slots in core facilities.
3. **Billing & Invoicing:** Automates the billing process with integration capabilities for cost recovery and financial tracking.
4. **Reporting:** Offers detailed reports on usage statistics, financial data, and operational metrics.
5. **Help Resources:** Includes a variety of help articles, FAQs, video tutorials, and support from the iLab team to assist users.

iLab is hosted on regional servers to optimize performance and comply with local data regulations. Users can log in using their institutional credentials if their institution has Single Sign-On (SSO) integration with iLab or utilize provided login details specific to their region.

For more detailed information about its functionalities and how to use it effectively, there are multiple resources such as quick-start guides, frequently asked questions (FAQs), detailed articles sorted by user roles (core customers, lab group managers), video tutorials, and direct support from the iLab Support Team available through the platform.

results.answer:
[RAG3] iLab, also known as iLab Operations Software, is a comprehensive platform designed to support the management and operation of shared research resources within institutions. It provides tools for scheduling equipment, managing service requests, tracking usage, and handling billing processes. The software is widely used by core facilities, laboratories, and other research groups to streamline their operations. Key features include:

1. **Signup and Login:** Provides various methods for users to create accounts and log in, including institutional single sign-on (SSO) integration.
2. **User Role-Specific Resources:** Offers tailored guides and help articles based on user roles such as Core Customers, Lab Group Managers, and Core Administrators.
3. **Scheduling and Reservations:** Allows users to reserve equipment or services efficiently while offering notifications for cancellations.
4. **Billing Management:** Facilitates the management of billing processes related to resource usage.
5. **Support Resources:** Includes FAQs, video tutorials, quick-start guides, detailed manuals, and direct support options.

Overall, iLab aims to optimize the utilization of shared resources in research environments by improving efficiency and providing robust administrative tools.

For more specific information or assistance with iLab functionalities:
- Visit the [iLab Help Site](https://nextgen-community.agilent.com/technical/ilab---stage-environment-testing/w/resources).
- Refer to popular resources like the iLab Quick-Start Guide or FAQs.
- Contact the iLab Support Team directly if needed.

Sources: 
1. Agilent Knowledge Base Articles
2. HelpJuice Articles
